folder: Richmond Road & Amboy Road, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1) Richmond Road, at the S.W. corner of Amboy Road, showing the Black Horse Tavern. It was a resort of British officers during the Revolution.

February 22, 1883

Photo by Bradish J. Carroll
From William T. Davis Collection through P.L.Sperr.

(2) The Black Horse Tavern, years later.

About 1910

By Mulford Simonson
From P.L.Sperr Collection.

(3) At a later date.

P.L.Sperr

April 30, 1929

folder: Amboy Road & Richmond Road, Staten Island, NY
text:
Amboy Road: The family lives in the tar-paper shack while the brick house grows.

1924.

P.L. Sperr

folder: Richmond Road & Amboy Road, Staten Island, NY
text:
Richmond Road (right, tracks thereon), at the S.W. corner of Amboy Road, showing the Black Horse Tavern. It dates back to preRevolutionary days and was a popular gathering place for British
officers during the War for Independence.
1924.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Amboy Road & Richmond Road, Staten Island, NY
text:
Captain Ronald Anundsen Plaza, at Amboy Road.
May 18, 1937.
P. L. Sperr,
